alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 10:13AM MDT until May 30 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Warm temperatures and upstream dam releases will continue to result in increased river flows. For the South Fork of the Ogden River...including Huntsville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet (992 CFS), low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 4.9 feet (1157 cfs). - Forecast...The river is forecast to remain above minor flood stage through Friday, May 26, then decreasing thereafter. There is some uncertainty in exactly when the river will fall below flood stage due to chances for showers through the week. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992 cfs). &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday at 1200 PM MDT.
